intro: Epicranthes corneri, commonly known as the Cape Verde morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the Cape Verde Islands. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family, which includes many vines and climbing plants. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically blue or purple in color. It thrives in coastal areas and is adapted to the arid conditions of its native habitat. The leaves are heart-shaped and often have a velvety texture, adding to its ornamental appeal.
